pr_title: Updates the tokenizer settings for SearchableEntity and PrefixSearchableEntity

timeline.message:
BREAKING CHANGE: Changes the index settings for SearchableEntities.

The searchField only contains tokenized data solely for the purpose
of index lookups. There is no benefit of storing or retrieving this
data in either an ES field or the _source itself.

However, this is a breaking change, as this leads to a re-index
for subclasses of this entity.
Uses the new tokenization framework for SearchableEntities.

Adds a remark which encourages the user to fill storage.sharedSecret.

We also now prevent a startup warning in case it is not filled
(as the framework might be unused). If required, the framework
will emit an appropriate warning itself.
Uses the new tokenizer framework for PrefixSearchableEntities.

timeline.message: Simplifies the API used to provide custom search prefixes.
Updates to the simpler API of the Tokenizer.

Keeps the search contents in the _source field.

Otherwise we'd had to re-tokenized the data
in every update, which isn't guaranteed by the
framework.

Therefore this would open up a bunch of dataloss
problems when using this entity in certain circumstances.
Also, loading the field isn't that expensive anyway as it should
be quite small for most entities.
Uses the proper ToLowercaseProcessor and adds a JavaDoc.
